nodes.bodyText: ❓  out of scope for this ticket, but what happens when east and west are flipped? Not sure which one is supposed to be "greater", or if that logic applies at all for east and west

So east and west can be flipped because of the anti-meridian. But even with a bounding box not over the anti-meridian, it doesn't seem to matter if east and west are flipped on both 2D and 3D maps 🤷‍♀

why do we only want to call the validateGeo function when there is no error? if there was some other error, like you entered a value too large, and it defaulted to 90, but your north was still less than your south, we'd want to show the north < south error, right?

So in that case you laid out, it won't change to the north less than south error until onBlur. But this is to protect against clearing out other errors when north is not less than south. Since the same error state is being used for all errors, we don't want to clear out errors when north is greater than south yet there may be some other error, like invalid UTM/UPS or latitude cannot be empty
ohh i see okay, so we want all other errors to take precedence basically. fine by me
same question as above, why are we checking if theres no error?
✏️  doesnt really matter but we could change this to isDms or something, so it's more obvious it's a boolean
are we preserving the old logic where the "coordinates cannot be empty" error will only show up after clicking out?
Good catch, I just pushed a commit that brought that back
